frameDefinitions: A Resisting_entity is capable of resisting or does resist a physical Opposing_force to a level specified by the target.
An Experiencer can be described as having an emotion as induced by a Stimulus.
A physical Exerter, Action, or Force exerts energy at a level specified by the target.
An Entity is in motion  at a particular Speed, a momentaneous description of distance traveled per time.
The LUs in this frame describe the level that a Rate, or the variation in some quantity over a period of time, deviates from the norm.

A Behavior, attributed to an Evaluee, conforms with or is heavily influenced by a popular trend or practice, often in the realm of fashion, design, though extending social and interactional behavior in general.
frameExamples: The great and <t>impregnable</t> fortress still stands today.
The children <t>enjoyed</t> noise games and sing-songs.
Although an <t>energetic</t> and able warrior, Charlemagne tended to direct battles rather than fight in person.
The <t>rapid</t> increase in obesity is a major cause of concern.
Wearing flowered brocaded silks was <t>fashionable</t> in the first few years of the decade.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> is the item that resists the <fen>Opposing_force</fen> to the level specified by the target.

The <fen>Opposing_force</fen> is the item placed in opposition to the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen>. <fen>Opposing_force</fen> hinders, blocks, helps, or allows (lets) the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> to resist at the level specified by the target. Sometimes this Core role is incorporated in the target; otherwise, it is often null instantiated in example sentences.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> resists an external force.
The location where the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> resists an external force.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has an emotion as caused by the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Action</fen> that exerts an energy of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Exerter</fen> which exerts an energy of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Force</fen> that exerts an energy of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> exerts an energy.
The location where the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> exerts its energy.
The <fen>Entity</fen> whose <fen>Speed</fen> is under consideration.

The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is a function of the distance that the <fen>Entity</fen> moves in a given duration. With the adjectives of this frame this Frame Element is generally incorporated.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s speed.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Speed</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Speed</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> whose <fen>Rate</fen> is being described.
The <fen>Rate</fen> at which something happens during an <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Behavior</fen> which is trendy.
The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged to conform to some degree with popular fashion with respect to his or her behavior.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Behavior</fen> is trendy or fashionable.
The location where the <fen>Behavior</fen> is trendy..
listRoleExamples: These are made from a tough <fex>plastic foam</fex> and are very light to wear.
The fortress was impregnable <fex>to attack by hostile invaders</fex>.
The retaining wall was even weaker <fex>yesterday</fex>, and had begun to crumble.
They decided the tree-house would be sturdiest <fex>in the big old backyard oak</fex>.
He was given a vigorous <fex>slap</fex> on the ear for his behavior.
More deadly and painful is the chemical weaponry of the camouflaged but lethargic <fex>stonefish</fex>.
They were trying to harness some of the lightening's intense <fex>power</fex>.
Charlie's workout was intense even <fex>first thing in the morning</fex>.
Because of the added space, our ultimate frisbee game was more vigorous <fex>in Golden Gate Park</fex>.
Anthony marveled at the rapid <fex>rate</fex> of production.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: a little tedious with as few as five
